file_content.text: The network is secure, thanks to you.
I can't believe this. We follow the slime right to the slug himself and... and....
Forgive me. Eliminating Zero is no small feat, but I still don't understand.
He was creative, he was personal, even vindictive. How could a droid replicate that behavior?
Maybe malicious attacks aren't as creative as you think.
You gave him too much credit.
I suppose we could learn from his model.
It also alerted us to the threat of this free droid enclave. We'll figure out who or what had a hand in his creation.
Where there's a droid, there's a creator. Or at least a missing restraining bolt.
Ask his maker.
You have a point. He was in the free droid enclave. They haven't proven to be a strategic threat before.
But this changes everything. We will raid them to ensure they harbor no more surprises.
Excellent work. If I can't have my day in the sun, I can at least appreciate yours.
Credits are my concern.
Yes, I suppose you don't care to listen to the denials of an old man.
I've worried about my position being taken by a droid before, but never my enemy's.
We will pay attention to the free droid enclave from now on. If this threat could come out of there, our next great gain might as well.
Once we can trace him through the hubs, he'll have nowhere to hide.
Commander Stron here. Nice work with that slicer in the data center. I don't suppose you'd be up for more of that sort of thing?
Commander Stron here. I heard about some of your work for General Kolvin. Impressive.
Commander Stron here. I've heard from Agent Felth that it's good to have you on our side in tough times.
Commander Stron here. The Shadow Syndicate's been passing word that you're willing to take on the tough fights.
Commander Stron. I'm glad you're here. I've heard I can't meet any better for help in a tough situation.
A slicer's compromising our computers. Only name we've got is "Zero."
I know that's normally below your notice, but this is Central Hub Prime. All our communications flow through here, including top secret military data.
Normally, I wouldn't bother a Sith with this, my lord, but this is Central Hub Prime. All our communications, military data, it all goes through here.
This is Central Hub Prime. All our communications go through here, including top secret military data. Imperial Intelligence, they want him stopped.
This is Central Hub Prime. All our communications go through here, including top secret military data. We'll pay well to protect it.
This slicer, this "Zero," is dangerous. We sent a termination squad after him--none returned.
So we don't catch him, then what?
We care about one slicer?
Last time Zero surfaced, he got into spaceport traffic control. Two thousand casualties were traced to a code change he personally signed.
I can help.
I'll take the job.
If a slicer killed your men, you need better men.
So they failed.
The bodies all bore the marks of military-grade blasters. He's as dangerous on the ground as in the networks.
The only chance we have to track him is by implanting tracer spikes into some of the Hutts' most secure hubs.
We can't support this officially, so there can be no witnesses, guards or otherwise.
The Empire will not allow some rebellious child to humiliate us again.
I will find this slicer.
Thank you, my lord.
If the price is right, I'll get your slicer.
I'll hunt him down.
I'll pay scale plus fifty out of my own pocket.
Rest assured, no one will trace our presence.
I'll get him.
If your reputation holds, I have little to worry about.
Give me the mission details.
We need you to physically plant tracer spikes in the computers through which Zero is sending his signal.
We'll have a technician waiting on the ground to trace Zero through your spikes and give you his locale.
Then, when you're finally face-to-face... make him beg.
I think you want someone more technical.
I can't. [Refuse quest.]
We had several; unfortunately, they were on board a starship when Zero sliced the traffic control tower.
Our networks are secure. None shall say otherwise.
